review.title: Ontology - Based Dynamic Business Process Customization
review.abstract: The interaction between business models is used in consumer centric manner instead of using a producer centric approach for customizing the business process in cloud environment. The knowledge based human semantic web is used for customizing the business process It introduces the Human Semantic Web as a conceptual interface, providing human-understandable semantics on top of the ordinary Semantic Web, which provides machine-readable semantics based on RDF in this mismatching is a major problem. To overcome this following technique automatic customization detection is an automated process of detecting possible elements or variables of a business process that needto be especially treated in order to suit the requirement of the other process. To the business processto be customized as the primary business process and those that it collaborates with as secondary business process or SBP Automatic customization enactment is an automated process of taking actions to perform the customization on the PBP according to the detected customization spots and the automatic reasoning on the customization conceptualization knowledge framework. The process of customizing businessprocesses by composite the web pages by using web service.

sections.text: The interaction between business models is used in a consumer-centric manner instead of a producer-centric approach to adapting the business process in a cloud environment; the knowledge-based human semantic web is used to adapt the business process; it introduces the human semantic web as a conceptual user interface that, in addition to the ordinary semantic web, provides a human-comprehensible semantics that provides machine-readable semantics based on RDF in this imbalance. To overcome this following technique, automatic adaptation detection is an automated process that identifies possible elements or variables of a business process that need to be specifically addressed to meet the needs of the other process; to adapt the business process as a primary business process; and those that it collaborates with as a secondary business process, or SBP Automatic adaptation, is an automated process that takes action to adapt to the identified adaptations and the automated arguments on the knowledge concepts.

sections.heading: Keywords
sections.text: It is not the first time that the EU Commission has taken such a step.

sections.heading: Primary Business Process, Secondary Business Process, Human Semantic Web, Composite Web Service.

sections.heading: 1. INTRODUCTION
sections.text: This year, it has come to the point that there will only be one such event until such an event occurs.

sections.heading: 2. CUSTOMIZATION DETECTION
sections.text: In Figure 3.1 Customization Detector, Scoper and Instrumentor identify all customizable content in the PBP and identify those that require customization due to discrepancies with the secondary business process, and the result is recorded by the Record Writer in Event Records. Customization Detector relies on the NLP Rule Engine to draw conclusions from the OWL-BPC ontology for knowledge of business process customization, and also relies on the OnExCat categorization tool to overcome the semantic heterogeneity of different business process descriptions.

sections.heading: 2.1. Ontology Matching
sections.text: The ExCat tool, which is used for ontology, compares two important elements that enable an automatic way of processing business process adaptations: the upper ontology of a business process and the upper ontology of process adaptation. Both upper ontologies must connect to the domain ontology during inference by an inference technique. An upper ontology for adapting business processes such as OWL-BPC is enabled by the presence of a machine. 1. Business Process FrameworkUnderstanding knowledge framework about what, when and how the adaptation should be performed. In the categorization of ontology instances, the terms are treated as a category search problem.

sections.heading: 3. CUSTOMIZATION ENACTOR
sections.text: Figure 3.1 shows that the Customization Enactor consists of the Event Generator, the Customization Executor, and the Notification Dispatcher. The Event Generator records the event logs and generates events; the events are forwarded to the NLP Rule Engine for processing; the rules of the Customization Engine are pre-processed by a Rule Editor that is not shown in the figure above; the NLP Rule Engine passes the action command, if any rules are triggered, to the Customization Executor to execute the customization; it also forwards the events to the Notification Dispatcher, which is the owner of the PBP and the SBPs.KQML (Knowledge Query and Manipulation Language) is a language and protocol for communication between software agents and knowledge-based systems; the KQML message format and protocol can be used to interact with an intelligent system, either through the other system, or through the application program.

sections.heading: 4. SEMANTIC DESIGN FOR PROCESS CUSTOMIZATION
sections.text: The KQML (Knowledge Query and Manipulation Language) is a language and protocol for communication between software agents and knowledge-based systems. The KQML message format and protocol can be used to interact with an intelligent system, either through an application program or through another intelligent system. KQML's are operations that agents perform on the basis of mutual knowledge. NLP (Natural Language Processing) conclusion is used to understand the keywords entered by the user and assemble the associated web service for collecting the desired result. The broker maps the keyword to the Wikipedia word network for the answer compilation to show the results.

sections.heading: 5. CONCLUSION
sections.text: Behavioral adjustment in non-trivial cases may depend on the runtime context of the business process execution. To develop a more comprehensive theoretical framework for solving this problem, the framework is only able to perform the adjustment statically before the business process is instantiated. As the OWL-BPC is to handle both static and dynamic adjustment in the course of implementing a dynamic adjustment capacity during or after the instantiation time, Figure 6.1 shows the comparison graph between the inference control machines used in the framework of business process customization. By using the Natural Language Inference, the adjustment efficiency is increased compared to the existing one. The human semantic web in terms of customizing the processes of automated business transactions by taking into account the various characteristics of individual business partners, the way in which companies nowadays operate is more dependent on electronic devices and documents in a networked manner. The use of such documents and most of such documents is supported by the effective web technology.

sections.heading: Authors
sections.text: Prof.V.Karthikeyan holds a Bachelor's degree in Electronics and Communications Engineering from PGP College of Engineering and Technology in Namakkal, India. He received his Master's degree in Applied Electronics from KSR College of Technology, Erode in 2006. He currently works as an Assistant Professor at SVS College of Engineering and Technology, Coimbatore, India. She holds a Master's degree in Energy Systems Engineering from Anna University of Technology, Coimbatore. She currently works as an Assistant Professor at Sri Krishna College of Engineering and Technology, Coimbatore She has approximately 5 years of teaching experience Mr. P.Jeyakumar is currently pursuing his Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering in Karpagore, Coimbatore, India.

referenceMentions.context: The [4]Semantic Web contains three levels of semantic interoperability: isolation, coexistence, and collaboration.
Web service composition [6] refers to the creation of new (Web) services by combination of functionality provided by existing ones.

Given the upper ontology for services and domain ontologies, service matching scheme determines whether a given Web service is a possible replacement using a categorization utility called OnExCat [5].

RDF [10] has features that facilitate data merging even if the underlying schemas differ, and it specifically supports the evolution of schemas over time without requiring all the data consumers to be changed.
